intro: Calyptranthes boldinghii, commonly known as the Boldinghii calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and is of interest to horticulturists and plant enthusiasts.
